reviews.text: I booked my hotel stay, from August 22 to 25th, using my Club Carlson points. After reading reviews from Tripadvisors, I requested a room away from the highway noise and a renovated room. The majority of the hotel reviews I read were not very kind; so my expectations for the hotel were not very high. Upon arrival, I was told that they could honor my room request. My room was located at the 3rd floor, from the walkway you can see the swimming pool.

reviews.text: My wife and I stayed here Thanksgiving night. Based on the mixed reviews, we were a little hesitant, but thought we'd give it a try anyway. We'll definitely be back!
reviews.title: Wonderful staff - recently remodeled

reviews.text: The person who checked us in, Christine, was an absolute delight. I'm sure she would have rather been with her family on Thanksgiving Day, but she sure didn't let that show. She greeted us with a cheerful, "Happy Thanksgiving!" She then completed our check-in in a most friendly and helpful way. Not only did she make us not feel guilty for checking in on a holiday (I hate making others work on holidays...) she actually made us feel welcome as if she was glad we were there.

reviews.text: Our suite was recently remodeled - new carpet, new paint, new furniture, 2 LCD TVs, new bathroom (except tub/shower). They even got rid of the old popcorn texture stuff on the ceiling. Nothing to complain about regarding the room at all.

reviews.text: The hotel is set up around a courtyard area which is beautifully landscaped. Several nice areas to sit outside at tables or on benches and enjoy the California weather. Breakfast outside was wonderful!

This is an old property, and some of the outside could use a fresh coat of paint or something to brighten it up. But the landscaping is beautiful and the rooms (at least the one we stayed in) are newly remodeled. We will be back.

reviews.text: I checked in just before midnight, tired after a long day of driving and work. the room key they gave me didn't work, so I spent about 20 minutes from walking into the lobby to walking into my room. I was tired, so when I got into bed and noticed all of the pillowcases were dirty and there was hair in and on the bed, I just picked the cleanest pillow and went to sleep. in the morning I saw a long string of plastic on the floor, and realized the room had not been cleaned prior to my arrival. I told the front desk at checkout and she gave me a 20% discount. I went to the vending machine to buy a water for the road and lost the $2 in the machine. thanks radisson.

reviews.text: Our family stayed here for a week while on vacation. We were given an extended stay rate which was very good. The hotel is convenient to the freeway as well as shopping and restaurants. There is not an included breakfast in the rate but a restaurant is on site if you want to purchase breakfast (or other meals). The room was decent size and ours had a sleep number bed (which some folks like a lot more than I do). The staff was friendly enough but service was inconsistant. With three people in the room, it would have been nice to be given more than two bath towels. We had to call up for an extra on multiple occasions. Also, our toilet seat was broken and we had to call to have it replaced. The air conditioning was inconsistant as well. Our thermostat didn't seem to be adjustable and the room was normally very hot. When it did finally cool down, the staff would turn the AC off when cleaning the room so it was warm again when we returned. The grounds are nice and feel secure compared to other options in the area. Our stay wasn't bad but could have been better with some small adjustments.

I picked the Radisson because I was traveling with small children, so we needed a suite so we could put them to sleep early in one room without having to go to sleep at the same time. Unfortunately there was no door separating our rooms, which totally defeated the purpose of getting a suite. Also it took several hours and multiple phone calls before a crib was brought up to our room.
